question: When does the law require lights on vehicles to be turned on?
choice1: Between sunset and sunrise
choice2: Between dusk and dawn and at any other time you cannot see clearly for a distance of 150 m (500 ft.)
choice3: Between half an hour before sunset and half an hour after sunrise and at any other time you cannot see clearly for a distance of 150 m (500 ft.)

question: In what position on the roadway must you be before making a left turn from a one-way traffic street?
choice1: Close to the right-hand side of the roadway
choice2: Close to the centre line of the roadway
choice3: Close to the left side of the roadway
choice4: Does not matter provided you signal

question: When two cars reach an uncontrolled intersection at approximately the same time, the right-of-way shoild be given to:
choice1: The one approaching from the left
choice2: The one approaching from the right
choice3: Neither one

question: When a streetcar stops to take on or discharge passengers, where there is no safety zone, what does the law require you to do before passing the streetcar?
choice1: Stop behind the rear of the streetcar and then proceed
choice2: Sound horn and pass with caution
choice3: Pass on the left side when the way is clear
choice4: Stop 2 m (6 ft.) behind te rearmost door where passengers are getting on or off, and proceed only when it is safe to do so

question: When it is safe to do so, passing other vehicles on the right side:
choice1: Is permitted on any street or highway
choice2: Is permitted providing it is possible to do so by driving on the shoulder of the road
choice3: Is not permitted under any circumstances
choice4: Is permitted when the street or highway has two or more lanes for traffic in the direction you are travelling

question: Which of the following has the right-of-way over all others at an intersection when the signal light is green?
choice1: Pedestrians crossing against the light
choice2: Pedestrians crossing with the light
choice3: Vehicles turning right

question: On a roadway where traffic is moving in both directions, in what position must you be before making a left turn?
choice1: Close to the right-hand side of the roadway
choice2: Close to the left side of the roadway
choice3: Immediately to the right of the centre line of the roadway
choice4: Does not matter provided you signal

question: When a red signal light wtih a green arrow is shown at an intersection it means:
choice1: Stop and wait for the green light before making a turn in the direction of the arrow
choice2: Proceed with caution in the direction of the arrow, yielding right-of-way to pedestrians and other traffic
choice3: Stop and then proceed
choice4: The green arrow is a signal for pedestrians only

question: When entering a freeway you should:
choice1: Stop on acceleration lane, wait for an opening, then enter the freeway rapidly
choice2: Accelerate quickly to freeway speed and merge with freeway traffic
choice3: Slow down, and then enter the freeway at a sharp angle
choice4: Drive slowly and be prepared to stop for freeway traffic

question: Every accident must be reported to the police where there is a personal injury of when the damage exceeds:
While travelling on a highway, the driver of a motor vehicle is not permitted to carry ______ in a house or boat trailer:
choice1: Firearms
choice2: Flammable material
choice3: People (passengers)

question: At what minimum blood alcohol level can the police immediately suspend your G license for three days for the first offence?
In Ontario, is there a seat belt law?
choice1: Yes
choice2: No
choice3: Only when driving on an open highway
choice4: Only when driving within a municipality

question: When lights are required, drivers must use lower beam headlights when following another vehicle:
choice1: Within 30 m (100 ft.)
choice2: Within 60 m (200 ft.)
choice3: Within 120 m (400 ft.)
choice4: This only applies when approaching another vehicle

question: If the signal light changes from green to amber (yellow) as you approach an intersection, what should you do?
choice1: Stop. If stop cannot be made safely, proceed with caution
choice2: Speed up to clear the intersection as quickly as possible
choice3: Continue through intersection without slowing or stopping
choice4: Sound horn to warn pedestrians and other drivers that you do not intend to stop

question: Upon approaching a Yield-sign, what does the law require you to do?
choice1: Slow down, stop if necessary, and yield right-of-way
choice2: Stop, then enter traffic slowly
choice3: Stop, then enter traffic quickly
choice4: Speed up and force your way into traffic

question: A person whose driver's license is under suspension, may:
choice1: Operate a motor vehicle in a case of extreme emergency
choice2: Operate a motor vehicle to and from work
choice3: Operate a motor vehicle when accompanied by a licensed driver
choice4: Not operate a motor vehicle under any conditions

question: Are drivers responsible for their passengers buckling up?
choice1: Only if passengers are over sixteen years of age
choice2: Only if passengers are under sixteen years of age
choice3: Only if passengers are in the front seat
choice4: Only if passengers are over eighteen years of age

question: Before leaving your car parked on a downgrade, you should:
choice1: Leave your front wheels parallel to the curb
choice2: Turn your front wheels to the left and set your parking brake
choice3: Set your parking brake only
choice4: Turn your front wheels to the right and set your parking brake

question: When a right turn against a red signal light is permitted, what does the law require you to do before entering the intersection and making the turn?
choice1: Slow down, proceed with caution
choice2: Stop, then edge into traffic
choice3: Signal, stop, make the turn so as not to interfere with other traffic, including pedestrians

question: The best way to stop quickly on a wet or icy roadway is to:
choice1: Pump the brake until you come to a stop
choice2: Keep foot off the brake and let compression stop you
choice3: Step on the brakes hard and try to prevent the vehicle from skidding
choice4: Apply brakes the same way you always do

question: In what lane of traffic should you drive when you intend to make a right-hand turn
choice1: Close to the left side of the roadway
choice2: Cloes to the right-hand side of the roadway
choice3: Close to the centre line of the roadway
choice4: Does not matter provided you signal

question: When driving in heavy fog, you should use:
choice1: Parking lights
choice2: Low beam headlights
choice3: Parking lgihts and high beam headlights

question: A flashing red signal light at an intersection means:
choice1: Slow down and drive with increased caution
choice2: Slow down and if necessary yield right-of-way to cars approaching from the left or right
choice3: Signal light is out of order; proceed with caution
choice4: Stop. Proceed only when it is safe to do so

question: As a level one or level two driver, if you collect nine or more demerit points during a two-year period, your license will be suspended for?
choice1: 60 days
choice2: 30 days
choice3: 1 year

question: If someone is tailgating you, what should you do?
choice1: Move into another lane when it is safe to do so
choice2: Slow down slightly to increase the space in front of your car
choice3: Pull over to let the tailgater pass

question: To get your vehicle out of a skid (e.g your rear wheels suddenly slip to the right), you should first:
choice1: Steer in the opposite direction of the skid
choice2: Steer straight ahead
choice3: Apply brakes hard
choice4: Steer in the direction of the skid

question: If you want to pass a motorcycle, you should:
choice1: Honk your horn before you pass
choice2: Turn on your high-beam lights before you pass
choice3: Pass just as you would with another car
choice4: Use half of their lane to pass

question: If you lose control of your vehicle and it goes off the road, you should:
choice1: Grip the steering wheel firmly
choice2: Take your foot off the gas pedal to slow down and avoid heavy braking
choice3: When the vehicle is under control, steer back to the road

question: Under the Criminal Code, if you are caught driving while your license is suspended, your vehicle will be impounded for?
choice1: 1 year
choice2: 6 months
choice3: 45 days

question: The police have the right to stop any driver they suspect is impaired. If you refuse to take a breathalyzer test, your liccence will be suspended immediately for:
choice1: 30 days
choice2: 1 year
choice3: 60 days

question: When on streets designed for two-way traffic, you hear the siren of an emergency vehicle, what does the law require you to do?
choice1: Speed up and get out the way
choice2: Signal the driver to pass
choice3: Pull to the right as far as possible and stop

question: Snow tires are good for:
choice1: Summer driving
choice2: All season driving
choice3: Winter driving

question: When lights are required, drivers are required to use low beam headlights?
choice1: Within 1 km (0.6 miles) of the approach of another vehicle
choice2: Within 150 m (500 ft.) of the approach of another vehicle
choice3: Within 300 m (1000 ft.) of the approach of another vehicle
choice4: This is a safety practice, not a law;

question: Under the Highway Traffic Act, if you are convicted of driving while your license is suspended, assuming it is your first offence, you will:
choice1: Receive a fine of $500
choice2: Be fined between $1000 to $5000
choice3: Be sentenced to six months in jail

question: At an intersection where there is a flashing amber (yellow) traffic light, you must:
choice1: Stop if making right turn
choice2: Continue at same speed
choice3: Stop if making left turn
choice4: Slow down and proceed with caution

question: Never change lanes in traffic without:
choice1: Giving proper signals and looking to make sure the move can be made safely
choice2: Decreasing speed and giving correct signal
choice3: Looking into the rear view mirror only
choice4: Blowing your horn and looking to the rear

question: Under what circumstances may a driver's license be cancelled?
choice1: For faliure to attend for re-examination
choice2: For possession of an altered driver's license
choice3: For faliure to satisfactorily complete a driver's re-examination
choice4: Any or all of the above

question: When selling a motor vehicle to another person, you, the seller should:
choice1: Notify the Ministry of the changes of ownership within six days of date of sale
choice2: Go with the buyer to a vehicle license issuing office to carry out the change of ownership
choice3: If selling the vehicle without a Safety Standards Certificate, you must return the vehicle license plates and motor vehicle permit to a vehicle license issuing office and obtain an Unfit Vehicle Permit in the buyer's name

question: What documents may the police officer require a motor vehicle owner to produce?
choice1: If the motor vehicle is insured—a liablity insurance card
choice2: The motor vehicle ownership
choice3: If they are operating a motor vehicle—a valid driver's license

question: You should, under all conditions, drive at a speed which will allow you to:
choice1: Stop within 90 metres (300 ft.)
choice2: Stop within 60 metres (200 ft.)
choice3: Stop within a safe distance

question: What insurance protection does the owner get who pays the uninsured motor vehicle fee?
choice1: $10,000 insurance coverage
choice2: $20,000 insurance coverage
choice3: $35,000 insurance coverage

question: Which of the following penalties can the court impose on a person convicted of driving 50 km/h (30 mph) or more over the speed limit?
choice1: Suspension of license for 6 months
choice2: Suspension of license for 30 days and/or fine up to $10,000
choice3: Impoundment of motor vehicle for 6 months

question: As a level one (G1) driver, you must be accokpanied by a G or higher licensed driver, who has the following driving experience more than:
choice1: Three years
choice2: Four years
choice3: Eight years

question: When may you lend your driver's license?
choice1: Never
choice2: To another person who is learning to drive
choice3: For identification purposes only

question: Overdriving your headlights at night is dangerous because:
choice1: You are driving too fast
choice2: Your headlights are too bright
choice3: You cannot stop within the distance you can see
choice4: It is not good for the car battery

question: When approaching an intersection where a traffic signal is red and a policeman motions you to go through, you should:
choice1: Wait for the light to turn green
choice2: Obey the policeman's signal and go through at once
choice3: Call the policeman's attention to the red light
choice4: Stop to make sure they want you to go through

question: When a car stops to allow pedestrian to cross the street at the marked crosswalk, you should:
choice1: Pass the stopped car on the left
choice2: Sound horn for the driver of the stopped car to drive on
choice3: Pass the stopped car on the right
choice4: Not pass any car stopped to allow a pedestrian to cross

question: When a truck becomes disabled on the highway, where the speed limit is in excess of 60 km/h, flares or reflectors must be placed approximately what distance ahead of and to the rear of this disabled vehicle?
Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit allowed in cities, towns, villages, and built-up area is:
choice1: 30 km/h (20 mph)
choice2: 50 km/h (30 mph)
choice3: 40 km/h (25 mph)

question: How soon, after a licensed driver changes their name or address, are they required to notify the Ministry of Transportation and Communications?
choice1: Within 6 days
choice2: Within 15 days
choice3: Within 30 days
choice4: At any time prior to renewal of lincence

question: When the traffic signal light is facing you is red and you intend to go staight through the intersection, what must you do?
choice1: Stop, give pedestrians the right-of-way, then proceed with caution
choice2: Stop, proceed when the way is clear
choice3: Slow down, proceed when the way is clear
choice4: Stop, proceed only when the signal turns green and when the way is clear

question: If you are involved in a reportable accident, how soon must you make a report to your nearest provincial or municipal police officer?
choice1: At once
choice2: Within 24 hours
choice3: Within 48 hours

question: Upon approaching a stop sign, a driver must:
choice1: Slow down, sound horn and proceed
choice2: Slow down, and if the way is clear, proceed
choice3: Stop, sound horn, then proceed
choice4: Stop, and when it is safe to do so, proceed

question: You are required to keep a safe distance behind the vehicle in front of you at 50 kilometres (30 miles) an hour. You should keep at least:
choice1: Seven car lengths behind the other vehicle
choice2: Three car lengths behind the other vehicle
choice3: One car lengths behind the other vehicle
choice4: Five car lengths behind the other vehicle

question: A 'school bus' with red signal lights flashing, stops on a highway that has no median strip. What does the law require you to do when meeting or overtaking the bus?
choice1: Does not matter provided you sound the horn
choice2: Stop until the bus proceeds or the signal lights are no longer flashing
choice3: Wait for the appraoching vehicles to pass
choice4: Reduce speed and pass with caution

question: When the driver of another vehicle is about to overtake and pass your vehicle, you must:
choice1: Move to the right and allow such vehicle to pass
choice2: Speed up so that passing is not necessary
choice3: Signal the other driver to not pass
choice4: Move to the left to prevent passing

question: A G-license driver may be required to attend an interview and re-examination of his driving ability:
choice1: When 9 demerit points have been accumulated
choice2: When 3 demerit points have been accumulated
choice3: When 6 demerit points have been accumulated
choice4: When 15 demerit points have been accumulated

question: Should your right wheels drop off the roadway, what is the best way to get back on the roadaway?
choice1: Steer hard to left
choice2: Apply brakes and steer hard to the left
choice3: Take off gas pedal, turn back when vehicle has slowed

question: When approaching an intersection and you notice the roadway beyond the intersection is blocked with traffic, you should:
choice1: Keep as close as possible to the car ahead
choice2: Proceed slowly into the intersection until the traffic ahead moves
choice3: Stop before entering the intersection and wait until traffic ahead moves on
choice4: Sound horn to warn cars ahead to move on

question: When a streetcar stops to pick up or discharge passengers and there is a safety island, what does the law require you to do?
choice1: Pass with caution
choice2: Stop at least 2 metres behind the safety island
choice3: Sound horn and pass with caution
choice4: Pass on the left side of the streetcar

question: Most automobile skids are the result of:
choice1: Under-inflated tires
choice2: Over-inflated tires
choice3: Snow or ice on the road

question: What must a driver do before entering a highway from a private road or driveway?
choice1: Sound horn and proceed with caution
choice2: Enter or cross the highway as quickly as possible
choice3: Give hand signal then take right-of-way
choice4: Yield right-of-way to all vehicles approaching on the highway

question: Parking lights may be used
choice1: At any time
choice2: For parking only
choice3: When driving in heavy fog
choice4: When driving on well lighted street

question: If you are driving and suddenly one of your tires blows out, you shoud:
choice1: Concentrate on steering
choice2: Take your foot off the gas pedal to slow down
choice3: Bring the vehicle to a stop off the road

question: How close to a fire hydrant may you legally park?
choice1: 3 metres (10 ft.)
choice2: 4.5 metres (15 ft.)
choice3: 1.5 metres (5 ft.)

question: As a level two (G2) driver your alcohol level must not be over:
When you are deciding whether or not to make 'U' turn, your first consideration should be to check:
choice1: Traffic regulations
choice2: Presence of trees, fire hydrants, or poles near the curb
choice3: Turning radius of your car

question: Why is it necessary to check oaver your shoulder when changing lanes?
choice1: It is a good exercise for your neck
choice2: There will always be a blind spot in your mirrors, no matter how you adjust them
choice3: To see who is driving

question: A solid centre line on the roadway is on your side of a broken centre line. What does the solid centre line mean?
choice1: It is unsafe to overtake and pass
choice2: Pass only when no traffic is in sight
choice3: It is safe to overtake and pass

question: You must report an accident to the police under what condition
choice1: There is less than $600 damage
choice2: The damage is over $2000
choice3: If someone has been hurt or killed

question: Except when you intend to overtake and pass another vehicle or when you intend to make a left turn, you should:
choice1: Drive in the centre of the roadway
choice2: Always keep well to the right
choice3: Drive on the shoulder of the highway

question: If you are charged with impaired driving for the first offense under the Criminal Code for a blood alcohol of 0.08 or more, your license will be suspended for:
choice1: 3 days
choice2: 7 days
choice3: 30 days

question: Level one and level two drivers must have a blood alcohol level of zero when driving. New drivers caught drinking and driving will be charged under the Criminal Code and will get how many days of suspension?
choice1: 30 days
choice2: 60 days
choice3: 90 days

question: A flashing green light at an intersection, where left and right turns are permitted means:
choice1: You may turn to the left if the way is clear
choice2: You may turn to the right if the way is clear
choice3: You may proceed straight through if the way is clear
choice4: You may do any of the above

question: If you are driving and your cellular phone rings, what should you do?
choice1: Pick up the phone quickly and talk briefly while driving
choice2: Check your messages when you are parked
choice3: Answer your phone if there are no police around
choice4: It is illegal to talk on the cellular while driving

question: If a traffic signal changes while a pedestrian is still in the street, which of the following has the right-of-way?
choice1: Motorists making turns
choice2: The pedestrian
choice3: Motorists coming from his right

question: Highway 407 is:
choice1: The longest highway is Ontario
choice2: Is a new highway
choice3: Is an express toll route (paid toll highway)

question: Except when passing, what distance must be maintained between commercial vehicles travelling in the same direction on the highway outside a city, town, or village?
To what penalties is a driver liable who is convicted of driving while disqualified?
choice1: A fine of $500 or imprisonment for six months or both
choice2: Impoundment of the motor vehicle being operated for three months
choice3: An additional 6-month period of suspension of driving privilege
choice4: Any or all of the above

question: A flashing blue light mounted on a motor vehicle indicates:
choice1: A motor vehicle carrying explosives
choice2: Snow removal equipment
choice3: An ambulance

question: When approaching a railway crossing at which an electrical or mechanical signal device is warning of the appraoch of a train, you must:
choice1: Stop not less tahn 1.5 m (5 ft.) from the nearest rail
choice2: Increase speed and cross tracks as quickly as possible
choice3: Stop not less than 5 m (15 ft.) from the nearest rail
choice4: Slow down and proceed with caution

question: If you are involved in an accident in which someone is injured you must:
choice1: Report the accident at once to the nearest provincial or municipal police officer
choice2: Report the accident within 48 hours to the nearest provincial or municipal police officer
choice3: Report the accident to your insurance company only
choice4: Report the accident to the Ministry of Transportation and Communcations only

question: Under which of the following conditions is it dangerous and unlawful to make a 'U' turn?
choice1: Upon a curve or on a hill where there is a clear view of less than 150 m (500 ft.) in either direction
choice2: On a railway crossing or within 30 m (100 ft.) of a railway crossing
choice3: Within 150 m (500 ft.) of a bridge, viaduct, or tunnel if driver's view is obstructed
choice4: Under all of the above conditions

question: Demerit points lost wil remain on your driver's record for a period of _________ ,from the date of offence:
choice1: One year
choice2: Two years
choice3: Three years

question: Before moving your car from a parked position, you should:
choice1: Check other traffic, signal and pull from curb quickly
choice2: Honk your horn and pull from curb slowly
choice3: Check other traffic, signal, and pull from curb when it is safe to do so

question: If you are approaching an intersection and the traffic lights are not working, you should:
choice1: Yield to the traffic to your right
choice2: Stop until no cars are passing then go
choice3: Treat it as a four way stop sign
choice4: Slow down and proceed with caution

question: When descending a steep hill a good safe-driving practice is to:
choice1: Gear down and use motor to assist in braking
choice2: Turn off the ignition
choice3: Place the gear shift in neutral

question: Failing to stop for a school bus that is unloading passengers will:
choice1: Result in a one year jail sentence
choice2: Cost you 6 demerit points and a fine up to $1000
choice3: Get you a warning and a fine of $100
choice4: Result in retaking your road test

question: Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit on the highway outside of a city, town, village, or built-up area is:
choice1: 100 kilometres (60 miles) an hour
choice2: 80 kilometres (50 miles) an hour
choice3: 60 kilometres (40 miles) an hour

question: WHich of the following hand-and-arm signal is correct for slowing or stopping?
choice1: Arm out and up
choice2: Arm straight out the window
choice3: Arm out and down

question: If your brakes fail:
choice1: Pump the brake pedal
choice2: Apply the parking brake gently but firmly
choice3: Keep your hand on the release button (of the parking brake)

question: When driving a motor vehicle on the highway at night, you should use low beam headlights (dim lights) when:
choice1: Approaching an intersection
choice2: Meeting or following another vehicle
choice3: Another driver dims their lights
choice4: Blinded by the headlights of an approaching vehicle

question: Level one drivers (G1) must keep their blood alcohol level to zero percent and be accompanied by a class G driver with a blood alcohol level of less than:
It is more dangerous to drive at the maximum speed limit at night than during the day-time because:
choice1: Some drivers unlawfully drive with parking lights only
choice2: You cannot see as far ahead at night
choice3: The roadway are more apt to be slippery at night
choice4: Your reaction time is slower at night

question: As a level one or level two driver, you will have your license suspended if you collect 9 or more demerit points during a two year period. 60 days after suspension, your record will be reduced to:
choice1: 6 points
choice2: 4 points
choice3: 0 points

question: If you are a teenage driver aged 19 or umder, in the first six months after recieving your G2 license, how many teenage pasengers are you allowed to carry between mignight to 5 am?
choice1: 3 passengers aged 19 or under
choice2: No passengers aged 19 or under
choice3: 1 passanger aged 19 or under

question: If you are a teenage driver, after six months with your G2 license and until you obtain your full G license or turn 20, how many teenage pasengers are you allowed to carry between mignight to 5 am?
choice1: 3 passangers aged 19 or under
choice2: No passangers aged 19 or under
choice3: 1 passanger aged 19 or under

question: There are some exemptions for a teenaged G2 driver, if you are accompanied by a fully licensed driver with at least ____ years of driving experience in the front seat or if your young passengers are members of your immediate family? (Midnight to 5 am)
choice1: 2 years
choice2: 3 years
choice3: 4 years

question: The broken centre line on a roadway means you may:
choice1: Never pass
choice2: Pass if the way is clear
choice3: Pass at any time

question: If you are involved in an accident that was due to your use of a cellular phone while driving:
choice1: Your insurance will increase
choice2: You will be charged with careless driving and lose 6 demerit points
choice3: Your license will be suspended for one year
choice4: You will have to take your road test again

question: At night when you meet another vehicle with blindng bright lights, the safest thing to do is:
choice1: Open and shut your eyes rapidly
choice2: Look at the headlights of the approaching vehicle
choice3: Turn your high beam lights on
choice4: Look slightly to the right hand side

question: At 15 demerit points, your license is suspended, after 30 days, the number of points on the driver's record is:
choice1: Reduced to 7 points
choice2: Reduced to 0 points
choice3: Reduced to 5 points

question: When 15 or more demerit points have accumulated on a record, the driver's license is suspended:
choice1: Automatically, and for 30 days from receipt of license
choice2: At the discretion of the Ministry
choice3: Only if the license is NOT used for business purposes

question: The Ministry of Transportation and Communications may suspend a license after a 9 demerit point interview:
choice1: If the driver fails to give satisfactory reason(s) for why their license should not be suspended
choice2: If the driver does not have at least 5 years of driving experience
choice3: If the license is not needed for business reasons
choice4: The Ministry is not permitted to suspend a license before the 15-point level is reached
